oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Balancing soil nutrient availability on commercial organic farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Robertson, J F
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Soils from two commercial farms were analysed for cation exchange capacities with the aim of improving the balance of available nutrients at soil level, and to support the basic organic principle of maintaining and improving the long-term fertility and microbiological activity of the soil.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Robertson, J F (2006) Balancing soil nutrient availability on commercial organic farms. In: Atkinson, C; Ball, B; Davies, D H K; Rees, R; Russell, G; Stockdale, E A; Watson, C A; Walker, R and Younie, D (Eds.) Aspects of Applied Biology 79, What will organic farming deliver? COR 2006, Association of Applied Biologists, pp. 297-299.
